page.title: 09CATON ROAD DEVELOPMENT I
page.content: Caton Road is the main going east out of Lancaster.Also going in the same direction is the remains of a railway line which ran on the land between the road and the river.The railway line was begun in 1847 and ran from Green Ayr Station,(opposite the Kingsway Baths nowadays),to Yorkshire.It was closed in 1965 when Dr Beeching cut down the railway routes.Nowadays the route is being made into a footpath and cycle track from Lancaster to Caton passing through beautiful scenery of woods and fields.Yet when he leaves Lancaster the traveller only sees the back of factorys and derilict sites and has to walk about a mile before he sees John Rennie's beautiful aqueduct (built 1797 ) carrying the Lancaster Canal over the river.The cycle path ends after four miles,on the far side of Caton.
